name: Unknown?
text: This small delicate plant was located at the end of site 14 in May 2009. It had clusters of very tiny white flowers that had 6 petals. The laves are lanceloate and bipinately compound. The small fruit (.5-1cm) that are formed after polination at first glance look like they are encased in a soft fuzzy capsule. A closer look reveals that they are covered by sharp spines. Any help that may be provided to help us identify this plant would be greatly appreciated.
